Small business owners and their employees are struggling to make ends meet as we approach Christmas. Sadly, the Governor's unilateral actions only increase the obstacles these hardworking Americans face and will drive hundreds of business owners into bankruptcy. END

As the Governor imposes further restrictions on Minnesota’s residents and small businesses, he continues to withhold millions of dollars in unspent #CARESAct funds, appropriated by the federal government and allocated to our state months ago.

The Governor’s unscientific folly of closing restaurants and bars is exposed in our border communities. While our small businesses and mom and pop restaurants and bars are closed and moving toward bankruptcy, Minnesotans are simply driving to neighboring states to spend millions.

Every life is valuable, which is why Governor Walz should give up his emergency powers and begin to craft thoughtful policies with the state legislature to protect those most vulnerable and fully reopen Minnesota’s economy.
The Governor’s actions - which are not based upon scientific, accurate or persuasive data and fail to include discernible goals - are especially unnecessary in outstate Minnesota.

I’d like to thank my colleagues @RepRutherfordFL, @RepDean, @GReschenthaler, @RepMGS, and @RepArmstrongND for working with me on this bill to create a more just criminal justice system.

It’s on us to make sure that every American can access the care they need. This bill allows us to do just that by supporting mental health treatment for incarcerated individuals reentering society so they are able to lead safe and productive lives.

We are facing a mental health crisis that has only been made worse by the COVID-19 pandemic, and incarcerated populations are bearing the brunt of it due to the lack of social distancing and safety measures.

Today, I couldn’t be more proud to announce that my bipartisan bill, the Crisis Stabilization and Community Reentry Act, unanimously passed the House floor and now heads to the President’s desk for signature. https://trone.house.gov/media/press-releases/trone-bill-support-mental-health-treatment-incarcerated-individuals-unanimously
Institutions like @NIH are working tirelessly to develop cures to life-threatening illnesses. It's on us to make sure they have the resources they need to do just that.

Banning the box isn't just good for justice impacted individuals -- it's good for business. This year, @RepMaxineWaters and I introduced legislation to ban the box on private sector employment applications nationwide.
